intro: Dombeya befotakensis subsp. longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The species is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a velvety texture. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats at elevations above 1,500 meters.
